content: In the course of working on cargo's internals regarding metadata and timing, I noticed that we still support both pipelined and non-pipelined builds. I wondered, given how long pipelining has been the default, would it make sense to remove the non-pipelined build support and constant-fold away all that code, and just no-op the configuration option (perhaps with a warning)?
Do we still get any value out of that code? Is there an important case where people are disabling pipelining?
At this point I don't think it's ever disabled, so I think it's safe to remove
AFAIK actually no one ever wanted to disable it, it was just an easy way to transition from off-to-on-by-default when it was first implemented
